org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed

Class ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.assembly.consed.ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder

  • public class ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder
extends Object
    ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder will build an AssemblyTransformer instance that will convert an assembly into a consed package (ace file, phd file(s) etc).
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static PhredQuality DEFAULT_QUALITY_VALUE
      The default quality value to use if qualities not provided: 26.

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_QUALITY_VALUE

        public static final PhredQuality DEFAULT_QUALITY_VALUE
        The default quality value to use if qualities not provided: 26.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder

        public ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder(File consedRootDir,
                                        String filePrefix)
        Create a new ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder instance that will write out a consed package using the given parameters.
        Parameters:
        consedRootDir - the root directory of the consed package to write. Underneath this directory, this transformer will create and populate "edit_dir" and "phd_dir" or "phdball_dir" directories. if the consedRootDir does not yet exist, then the directory will be created. Can not be null.
        filePrefix - the file prefix to use for the ace and phd files to write. These files will named $filePrefix.ace.1 and $filePrefix.phd.ball.1 etc.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if any parameters are null. Can not be null.

    • Method Detail

      • setClock

        public ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder setClock(Clock clock)
        Set the Clock to use for the timestamps for various assembly metadata.
        Parameters:
        clock - a Clock instance; can not be null.
        Returns:
        this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clock is null.

      • createIndividualPhdFiles

        public ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder createIndividualPhdFiles(boolean createIndividualPhdFiles)
        Should individual phd files in the "phd_dir" directory be created instead of using one giant phd.ball file. Creating individual files is not recommended for next-gen assemblies since there will potentially be millions of reads and therefore millions of files in a single directory. However, this option is provided so that consed packages can be used on legacy consed installations or other ace and phd parser libraries and tools that don't support phd.ball. If this method is not called, then the default is to use a phd.ball file (similar to createIndividualPhdFiles(false)
        Parameters:
        createIndividualPhdFiles - true if should create individual phd files in the phd_dir; false if should use phd.ball in phdball_dir instead (default is false.
        Returns:
        this.

      • inputChromatogramDir

        public ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder inputChromatogramDir(File chromatDir)
        Provide a directory which contains sanger chromatograms to be included in this consed package. If the directory is not null and contains sanger trace files, then those traces will be copied and coverted into scf format under $consed_rootDir/chromat_dir so consed can see them and display the raw chromatogram channel wave forms.
        Parameters:
        chromatDir - the chormatDir to get the traces from; if null then there are no chroamtograms (defaults to null
        Returns:
        this

      • postProcessor

        public ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder postProcessor(AceAssemblyTransformerPostProcessor postProcessor)
        Set the AceAssemblyTransformerPostProcessor to use to modify the Ace contigs after the transformation service has provided all the alignment information.
        Parameters:
        postProcessor - the AceAssemblyTransformerPostProcessor to use; or null if there is no post processor (defaults to null ).
        Returns:
        this

      • setDefaultQualityValue

        public ConsedAssemblyTransformerBuilder setDefaultQualityValue(int qualityValue)
        Set the default quality value to use if an aligned read does not have associated quality data. If not called, then the default is DEFAULT_QUALITY_VALUE
        Parameters:
        qualityValue - the quality value to use; must be between 0 and Byte.MAX_VALUE.
        Returns:
        this.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if if qualityScore < 0 or > Byte.MAX_VALUE.

      • build

        public AssemblyTransformer build()
                          throws IOException
        Create a new AssemblyTransformer instance using the provided configuration.
        Returns:
        a new AssemblyTransformer will never be null.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the consed root dir or any of the underlying files (which may initially be empty until the AssemblyTransformer methods have been called.
